intro: Brachypeza zamboangensis, commonly known as the Zamboanga brachypeza, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
